review: It was updating for like an hour at 0%. I unplugged the USB to power cord for 20 seconds, and it zipped through the update -_-. This is a lot nicer than using my Xbox 360 to watch Netflix though. On the 360, episodes just autoplay, with my Android, I can read descriptions, etc. Also, 1080p > 720p, and no stupid xbox live fee.
author: John

review: I picked one up at a local bestbuy and I love this thing! I'm able to play hulu and netflix on it. Today Google announced HBO Go so I'm excited to try that out. I recommend chromecast to everyone!

review: I purchased this to stream videos from my IPad and phone to my TV. Setup could not have been easier. What a cool device and so easy to use. Shipping was extremely quick.

review: I got my Chromecast player and it was up and streaming in less than 10 minutes. My TV did not power it up directly so I needed to use the power adapter that came with the item. Once you log into their site, it will immediately identify the dongle and link to it. I tried it on Youtube, Google play and Hulu where it streamed easily. But not on Amazon video. Amazon, when will we be able to use this amazing device on Prime Instant Videos? If not, there is always Hulu and Netflix...

author: Stev

review: The Good:1. Easy to setup and use - when everything works exactly as intended.2. The direct play mode for Youtube has excellent picture quality.The Bad:1. Totally unusable performance when streaming from your PC's video player (the primary reason I purchased it) - picture freezes, stutters, out of sync, etc.2. No support or documentation - clearly #1 is a common issue - found many people complaining about it - but Google provides just about zero support. This appears to be the case for all issues with this device - if you have to go under the hood for any reason, Google provides no useful support.In Sum:I would not recommend this device - it fails to perform as promised.  There are less simple - but much more reliable - methods for streaming or directly playing video from your PC to your TV screen.  However, if you only want to stream from some service that is not on Roku and is one of the services that Google has setup for direct download with Chromcast (like Youtube), then this might be a solution for you.
author: VoxVulgus

review: I've owned 3 generations of Roku players and the latest generation of AppleTV, and I can say now that Chromecast has Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, Pandora, and HBO GO... this is the best media streaming solution (other than some custom-built open source system). The only thing missing is Amazon VOD, but really that's preference. The Google Play Movies works just as well.

review: Watching Youtube and listening to Pandora on my TV makes this one of the best buys we have made in some time.  We do not have DISH and can't get cable, makes this a great option at a very low price.
